Package GameLogic

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameLogic.Board
  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Board for the Othello game.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int DIM
      Dimension of the board, i.e., if set to 6, the board has 8 rows and 8 columns.

    • Field Detail

      • DIM

        public static final int DIM
        Dimension of the board, i.e., if set to 6, the board has 8 rows and 8 columns. Array of flippedDisc, is an array that contains the disc that should be flipped to the opponent's mark
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • flippedDiscs

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> flippedDiscs

      • fields

        public Mark[] fields
        The DIM by DIM fields of the Othello board.

        public Board()
        Creates an empty board and flippedDiscs array. Set centre of the board by default marks.

      • getFlippedDiscs

        array of indexes for flipped discs

      • checkMove

        public boolean checkMove​(int row,
                         int col,
                         Mark mark)
        Check the move for its correctness and what discs will be flipped for this particular move. The method go through each direction, starting at the given row and column and checking if the next field in that direction is the opponent's mark. --------- If it is, it adds that field to the list of potential flipped discs and continues checking in that direction until it either reaches the current player's mark or an empty field. 1) If it reaches the current player's mark, the move is considered valid. 2) If it reaches an empty field or out of boundaries, the move is considered invalid and the flipped discs added for that direction are removed from the list.
        Parameters:
        row - The row of the move
        col - The column of the move
        mark - The mark of the move
        Returns:
        True if the move is valid, false otherwise

      • isField

        public boolean isField​(int index)
        Returns true if index is a valid index of a field on the board.
        Parameters:
        index - of the fields
        Returns:
        true if 0 <= index < DIM*DIM

      • isField

        public boolean isField​(int row,
                       int col)
        Returns true if the (row,col) pair refers to a valid field on the board.
        Parameters:
        row - the field's row
        col - the field's column
        Returns:
        true if 0 <= row < DIM && 0 <= col < DIM

      • getField

        public Mark getField​(int i)
        Returns the content of the field i.
        Parameters:
        i - the number of the field
        Returns:
        the mark on the field

      • isEmptyField

                            int col)

        col - the column of the field
        Returns:

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        Tests if the whole board is full.
        Returns:
        true if all fields are occupied

      • getWinnerMark

        public Mark getWinnerMark()
        The method calculate the frequency of both marks and return the winner mark. A mark wins if it has more in quantity.
        Returns:
        the mark with the higher frequency. Or Empty Mark in case of draw

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representation of this board. In addition to the current situation, the String also shows the numbering of the fields.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the game situation as a String

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Empties all fields of this board (i.e., let them refer to the value Mark.EMPTY).

      • setField

        public void setField​(int row,
                     int col,
                     Mark m)
        Sets the content of the field represented by the (row,col) pair to the mark m.
        Parameters:
        row - the field's row
        col - the field's column
        m - the mark to be placed
